1986    Three Flashes or Below Threshold:* Web pages 1986    Three Flashes or Below Threshold:* Web pages
1987    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> do not 1987    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> do not
1988    contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one 1988    contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one
1989    second period, or the flash 1989    second period, or the flash
1990    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#flash-def> is below 1990    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#flash-def> is below
1991    the general flash and red flash thresholds 1991    the general flash and red flash thresholds
1992    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#general-thresholddef>. 1992    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#general-thresholddef>.
1993    (Level A) 1993    (Level A)
1994  1994 
1995    /Note: /Since any content that does not meet this success criterion 1995    /Note: /Since any content that does not meet this success criterion
1996    can interfere with a user's ability to use the whole page, all 1996    can interfere with a user's ability to use the whole page, all
1997    content on the Web page (whether it is used to meet other success 1997    content on the Web page (whether it is used to meet other success
1998    criteria or not) must meet this success criterion. See /Conformance 1998    criteria or not) must meet this success criterion. See /Conformance
1999    Requirement 5: Non-Interference 1999    Requirement 5: Non-Interference
2000    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#cc5>/. 2000    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#cc5>/.
2001  2001 
2002  2002 
2003      Intent of this Success Criterion 2003      Intent of this Success Criterion
2004  2004 
2005The intent of this Success Criterion is to allow users to access the 2005The intent of this Success Criterion is to allow users to access the
2006full content of a site without inducing seizures due to photosensitivity. 2006full content of a site without inducing seizures due to photosensitivity.
2007  2007 
2008Individuals who have photosensitive seizure disorders can have a seizure 2008Individuals who have photosensitive seizure disorders can have a seizure
2009triggered by content that flashes at certain frequencies for more than a 2009triggered by content that flashes at certain frequencies for more than a
2010few flashes. People are even more sensitive to red flashing than to 2010few flashes. People are even more sensitive to red flashing than to
2011other colors, so a special test is provided for saturated red flashing. 2011other colors, so a special test is provided for saturated red flashing.
2012These guidelines are based on guidelines for the broadcasting industry 2012These guidelines are based on guidelines for the broadcasting industry
2013as adapted for computer screens, where content is viewed from a closer 2013as adapted for computer screens, where content is viewed from a closer
2014distance (using a larger angle of vision). 2014distance (using a larger angle of vision).
2015  2015 
2016Flashing can be caused by the display, the computer rendering the image 2016Flashing can be caused by the display, the computer rendering the image
2017or by the content being rendered. The author has no control of the first 2017or by the content being rendered. The author has no control of the first
2018two. They can be addressed by the design and speed of the display and 2018two. They can be addressed by the design and speed of the display and
2019computer. The intent of this criterion is to ensure that flicker that 2019computer. The intent of this criterion is to ensure that flicker that
2020violates the flash thresholds is not caused by the content itself. For 2020violates the flash thresholds is not caused by the content itself. For
2021example, the content could contain a video clip or animated image of a 2021example, the content could contain a video clip or animated image of a
2022series of strobe flashes, or close-ups of rapid-fire explosions. 2022series of strobe flashes, or close-ups of rapid-fire explosions.
2023  2023 
2024This Success Criterion replaces a much more restrictive criterion in 2024This Success Criterion replaces a much more restrictive criterion in
2025WCAG 1.0 that did not allow any flashing (even of a single pixel) within 2025WCAG 1.0 that did not allow any flashing (even of a single pixel) within
2026a broad frequency range (3 to 50 Hz). This Success Criterion is based on 2026a broad frequency range (3 to 50 Hz). This Success Criterion is based on
2027existing specifications in use in the UK and by others for television 2027existing specifications in use in the UK and by others for television
2028broadcast and has been adapted for computer display viewing. The 1024 x 2028broadcast and has been adapted for computer display viewing. The 1024 x
2029768 screen is used as the reference screen resolution for the 2029768 screen is used as the reference screen resolution for the
2030evaluation. The 341 x 256 pixel block represents a 10 degree viewport at 2030evaluation. The 341 x 256 pixel block represents a 10 degree viewport at
2031a typical viewing distance. (The 10 degree field is taken from the 2031a typical viewing distance. (The 10 degree field is taken from the
2032original specifications and represents the central vision portion of the 2032original specifications and represents the central vision portion of the
2033eye, where people are most susceptible to photo stimuli.) 2033eye, where people are most susceptible to photo stimuli.)
2034  2034 
2035The combined area of flashes occurring concurrently and contiguously 2035The combined area of flashes occurring concurrently and contiguously
2036means the total area that is actually flashing at the same time. It is 2036means the total area that is actually flashing at the same time. It is
2037calculated by adding up the contiguous area that is flashing 2037calculated by adding up the contiguous area that is flashing
2038simultaneously within any 10 degree angle of view. 2038simultaneously within any 10 degree angle of view.
2039  2039 
2040/Note: /The terms "blinking" and "flashing" can sometimes refer to the 2040/Note: /The terms "blinking" and "flashing" can sometimes refer to the
2041same content. 2041same content.
2042  2042 
2043  * 2043  *
2044  2044 
2045    "Blinking" refers to content that causes a distraction problem. 2045    "Blinking" refers to content that causes a distraction problem.
2046    Blinking can be allowed for a short time as long as it stops (or can 2046    Blinking can be allowed for a short time as long as it stops (or can
2047    be stopped) 2047    be stopped)
2048  2048 
2049  * 2049  *
2050  2050 
2051    "Flashing" refers to content that can trigger a seizure (if it is 2051    "Flashing" refers to content that can trigger a seizure (if it is
2052    more than 3 per second and large and bright enough). This cannot be 2052    more than 3 per second and large and bright enough). This cannot be
2053    allowed even for a second or it could cause a seizure. And turning 2053    allowed even for a second or it could cause a seizure. And turning
2054    the flash off is also not an option since the seizure could occur 2054    the flash off is also not an option since the seizure could occur
2055    faster than most users could turn it off. 2055    faster than most users could turn it off.
2056  2056 
2057  * 2057  *
2058  2058 
2059    Blinking usually does not occur at speeds of 3 per second or more, 2059    Blinking usually does not occur at speeds of 3 per second or more,
2060    but it can. If blinking occurs faster than 3 per second, it would 2060    but it can. If blinking occurs faster than 3 per second, it would
2061    also be considered a flash. 2061    also be considered a flash.
2062  2062 
2063  2063 
2064        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.3.1 2064        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.3.1
2065  2065 
2066  * 2066  *
2067  2067 
2068    Individuals who have seizures when viewing flashing material will be 2068    Individuals who have seizures when viewing flashing material will be
2069    able to view all of the material on a site without having a seizure 2069    able to view all of the material on a site without having a seizure
2070    and without having to miss the full experience of the content by 2070    and without having to miss the full experience of the content by
2071    being limited to text alternatives. This includes people with 2071    being limited to text alternatives. This includes people with
2072    photosensitive epilepsy as well as other photosensitive seizure 2072    photosensitive epilepsy as well as other photosensitive seizure
2073    disorders. 2073    disorders.

2079  2079 
2080    A Web site has video of muzzle flash of machine gun fire, but limits 2080    A Web site has video of muzzle flash of machine gun fire, but limits
2081    the size of the flashing image to a small portion of the screen 2081    the size of the flashing image to a small portion of the screen
2082    below the flash threshold size. 2082    below the flash threshold size.

2087    edited so that the lightning only flashes three times in any one 2087    edited so that the lightning only flashes three times in any one
2088    second period. 2088    second period.

2337    Three Flashes:* Web pages 2337    Three Flashes:* Web pages
2338    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> do not 2338    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> do not
2339    contain anything that flashes 2339    contain anything that flashes
2340    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#flash-def> more than 2340    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#flash-def> more than
2341    three times in any one second period. (Level AAA) 2341    three times in any one second period. (Level AAA)
2342  2342 
2343  2343 
2344      Intent of this Success Criterion 2344      Intent of this Success Criterion
2345  2345 
2346The purpose of this Success Criterion is to further reduce the chance of 2346The purpose of this Success Criterion is to further reduce the chance of
2347seizures. Seizures cannot be completely eliminated since some people are 2347seizures. Seizures cannot be completely eliminated since some people are
2348so sensitive. However, by eliminating all 3-per-second flashing over any 2348so sensitive. However, by eliminating all 3-per-second flashing over any
2349area of the screen, the chances of a person having a seizure are further 2349area of the screen, the chances of a person having a seizure are further
2350reduced than when just meeting the measures ordinarily used today in 2350reduced than when just meeting the measures ordinarily used today in
2351standards internationally, as we do at Level A. 2351standards internationally, as we do at Level A.
2352  2352 
2353Whereas Success Criterion 2.3.1 2353Whereas Success Criterion 2.3.1
2354<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#seizure-does-not-violate> allows 2354<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#seizure-does-not-violate> allows
2355flashing if it is dim enough or has a small enough area, Success 2355flashing if it is dim enough or has a small enough area, Success
2356Criterion 2.3.2 does not allow flashing greater than 3 per second, 2356Criterion 2.3.2 does not allow flashing greater than 3 per second,
2357regardless of brightness or size. As a result, even a single flashing 2357regardless of brightness or size. As a result, even a single flashing
2358pixel would violate this criterion. The intent is to guard against 2358pixel would violate this criterion. The intent is to guard against
2359flashing larger than a single pixel, but since an unknown amount of 2359flashing larger than a single pixel, but since an unknown amount of
2360magnification or high contrast setting may be applied, the prohibition 2360magnification or high contrast setting may be applied, the prohibition
2361is against any flashing. 2361is against any flashing.
2362  2362 
2363/Note: /In some cases, what we refer to as "blinking" and what we refer 2363/Note: /In some cases, what we refer to as "blinking" and what we refer
2364to as "flashing" may overlap slightly. We are using different terms for 2364to as "flashing" may overlap slightly. We are using different terms for
2365the two because "blinking" causes a distraction problem which you can 2365the two because "blinking" causes a distraction problem which you can
2366allow for a short time as long as it stops (or can be stopped) whereas 2366allow for a short time as long as it stops (or can be stopped) whereas
2367"flashing" is a seizure trigger and cannot be allowed or it will cause a 2367"flashing" is a seizure trigger and cannot be allowed or it will cause a
2368seizure. The seizure would occur faster than most users could turn it 2368seizure. The seizure would occur faster than most users could turn it
2369off. "Blink" therefore refers to slow repeating changes that would 2369off. "Blink" therefore refers to slow repeating changes that would
2370distract. "Flash" refers to changes that could cause a seizure if they 2370distract. "Flash" refers to changes that could cause a seizure if they
2371were bright enough or persisted long enough. Blinking usually doesn't 2371were bright enough or persisted long enough. Blinking usually doesn't
2372occur at speeds of 3 per second or more so blink and flash do not 2372occur at speeds of 3 per second or more so blink and flash do not
2373overlap. However, blinking can occur faster than 3 per second so there 2373overlap. However, blinking can occur faster than 3 per second so there
2374could be an overlap. See /Understanding Success Criterion 2.2.2 Pause, 2374could be an overlap. See /Understanding Success Criterion 2.2.2 Pause,
2375Stop, Hide <#time-limits-pause>/ for more information on blink. 2375Stop, Hide <#time-limits-pause>/ for more information on blink.
2376  2376 
2377  2377 
2378        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.3.2 2378        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.3.2

2381  2381 
2382    Individuals who have seizures when viewing flashing material will be 2382    Individuals who have seizures when viewing flashing material will be
2383    able to view all of the material on a site without having a seizure 2383    able to view all of the material on a site without having a seizure
2384    and without having to miss the full experience of the content by 2384    and without having to miss the full experience of the content by
2385    being limited to text alternatives. This includes people with 2385    being limited to text alternatives. This includes people with
2386    photosensitive epilepsy as well as other photosensitive seizure 2386    photosensitive epilepsy as well as other photosensitive seizure
2387    disorders. 2387    disorders.

2553  2553 
2554    *Guideline 2.4: * Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, 2554    *Guideline 2.4: * Provide ways to help users navigate, find content,
2555    and determine where they are. 2555    and determine where they are.
2556  2556 
2557  2557 
2558      Intent of Guideline 2.4 2558      Intent of Guideline 2.4
2559  2559 
2560The intent of this guideline is to help users find the content they need 2560The intent of this guideline is to help users find the content they need
2561and allow them to keep track of their location. These tasks are often 2561and allow them to keep track of their location. These tasks are often
2562more difficult for people with disabilities. For finding, navigation, 2562more difficult for people with disabilities. For finding, navigation,
2563and orientation, it is important that the user can find out what the 2563and orientation, it is important that the user can find out what the
2564current location is. For navigation, information about the possible 2564current location is. For navigation, information about the possible
2565destinations needs to be available. Screen readers convert content to 2565destinations needs to be available. Screen readers convert content to
2566synthetic speech which, because it is audio, must be presented in linear 2566synthetic speech which, because it is audio, must be presented in linear
2567order. Some Success Criteria in this guideline explain what provisions 2567order. Some Success Criteria in this guideline explain what provisions
2568need to be taken to ensure that screen reader users can successfully 2568need to be taken to ensure that screen reader users can successfully
2569navigate the content. Others allow users to more easily recognize 2569navigate the content. Others allow users to more easily recognize
2570navigation bars and page headers and to bypass this repeated content. 2570navigation bars and page headers and to bypass this repeated content.
2571Unusual user interface features or behaviors may confuse people with 2571Unusual user interface features or behaviors may confuse people with
2572cognitive disabilities. 2572cognitive disabilities.
2573  2573 
2574As described in The Motive Web Design Glossary 2574As described in The Motive Web Design Glossary
2575<http://www.motive.co.nz/glossary/navigation.php>, navigation has two 2575<http://www.motive.co.nz/glossary/navigation.php>, navigation has two
2576main functions: 2576main functions:
2577  2577 
2578  * 2578  *
2579  2579 
2580    to tell the user where they are 2580    to tell the user where they are
2581  2581 
2582  * 2582  *
2583  2583 
2584    to enable the user to go somewhere else 2584    to enable the user to go somewhere else
2585  2585 
2586This guideline works closely with Guideline 1.3 2586This guideline works closely with Guideline 1.3
2587<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#content-structure-separation>, 2587<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#content-structure-separation>,
2588which ensures that any structure in the content can be perceived, a key 2588which ensures that any structure in the content can be perceived, a key
2589to navigation as well. Headings are particularly important mechanisms 2589to navigation as well. Headings are particularly important mechanisms
2590for helping users orient themselves within content and navigate through 2590for helping users orient themselves within content and navigate through
2591it. Many users of assistive technologies rely on appropriate headings to 2591it. Many users of assistive technologies rely on appropriate headings to
2592skim through information and easily locate the different sections of 2592skim through information and easily locate the different sections of
2593content. Satisfying Success Criterion 1.3.1 2593content. Satisfying Success Criterion 1.3.1
2594<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#content-structure-separation-programmatic> 2594<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#content-structure-separation-programmatic>
2595for headings also addresses some aspects of Guideline 2.4. 2595for headings also addresses some aspects of Guideline 2.4.

2603addressing this guideline that do not fall under any of the success 2603addressing this guideline that do not fall under any of the success

2606of Web content more accessible to more people. 2606of Web content more accessible to more people.

2636  2636 
2637  2637 
2638      Intent of this Success Criterion 2638      Intent of this Success Criterion
2639  2639 
2640The intent of this Success Criterion is to allow people who navigate 2640The intent of this Success Criterion is to allow people who navigate
2641sequentially through content more direct access to the primary content 2641sequentially through content more direct access to the primary content
2642of the Web page. Web pages and applications often have content that 2642of the Web page. Web pages and applications often have content that
2643appears on other pages or screens. Examples of repeated blocks of 2643appears on other pages or screens. Examples of repeated blocks of
2644content include but are not limited to navigation links, heading 2644content include but are not limited to navigation links, heading
2645graphics, and advertising frames. Small repeated sections such as 2645graphics, and advertising frames. Small repeated sections such as
2646individual words, phrases or single links are not considered blocks for 2646individual words, phrases or single links are not considered blocks for
2647the purposes of this provision. 2647the purposes of this provision.
2648  2648 
2649This is in contrast to a sighted user's ability to ignore the repeated 2649This is in contrast to a sighted user's ability to ignore the repeated
2650material either by focusing on the center of the screen (where main 2650material either by focusing on the center of the screen (where main
2651content usually appears) or a mouse user's ability to select a link with 2651content usually appears) or a mouse user's ability to select a link with
2652a single mouse click rather than encountering every link or form control 2652a single mouse click rather than encountering every link or form control
2653that comes before the item they want. 2653that comes before the item they want.
2654  2654 
2655It is not the intent of this Success Criterion to require authors to 2655It is not the intent of this Success Criterion to require authors to
2656provide methods that are redundant to functionality provided by the user 2656provide methods that are redundant to functionality provided by the user
2657agent. Most web browsers provide keyboard shortcuts to move the user 2657agent. Most web browsers provide keyboard shortcuts to move the user
2658focus to the top of the page, so if a set of navigation links is 2658focus to the top of the page, so if a set of navigation links is
2659provided at the bottom of a web page providing a "skip" link may be 2659provided at the bottom of a web page providing a "skip" link may be
2660unnecessary. 2660unnecessary.
2661  2661 
2662/Note: /Although this Success Criterion deals with blocks of content 2662/Note: /Although this Success Criterion deals with blocks of content
2663that are repeated on multiple pages, we also strongly promote structural 2663that are repeated on multiple pages, we also strongly promote structural
2664markup on individual pages as per Success Criteria 1.3.1. 2664markup on individual pages as per Success Criteria 1.3.1.
2665  2665 
2666  2666 
2667        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.1 2667        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.1
2668  2668 
2669  * 2669  *
2670  2670 
2671    When this Success Criterion is not satisfied, it may be difficult 2671    When this Success Criterion is not satisfied, it may be difficult
2672    for people with some disabilities to reach the main content of a Web 2672    for people with some disabilities to reach the main content of a Web
2673    page quickly and easily. 2673    page quickly and easily.
2674  2674 
2675  * 2675  *
2676  2676 
2677    Screen reader users who visit several pages on the same site can 2677    Screen reader users who visit several pages on the same site can
2678    avoid having to hear all heading graphics and dozens of navigation 2678    avoid having to hear all heading graphics and dozens of navigation
2679    links on every page before the main content is spoken. 2679    links on every page before the main content is spoken.
2680  2680 
2681  * 2681  *
2682  2682 
2683    People who use only the keyboard or a keyboard interface can reach 2683    People who use only the keyboard or a keyboard interface can reach
2684    content with fewer keystrokes. Otherwise, they might have to make 2684    content with fewer keystrokes. Otherwise, they might have to make
2685    dozens of keystrokes before reaching a link in the main content 2685    dozens of keystrokes before reaching a link in the main content
2686    area. This can take a long time and may cause severe physical pain 2686    area. This can take a long time and may cause severe physical pain
2687    for some users. 2687    for some users.
2688  2688

2692    same headings or other blocks of information to find where the 2692    same headings or other blocks of information to find where the
2693    content begins each time they enter a new page. 2693    content begins each time they enter a new page.

2703  * 2703  *
2704  2704 
2705    A news organization's home page contains a main story in the middle 2705    A news organization's home page contains a main story in the middle
2706    of the page, surrounded by many blocks and sidebars for advertising, 2706    of the page, surrounded by many blocks and sidebars for advertising,
2707    searching, and other services. There is a link at the top of the 2707    searching, and other services. There is a link at the top of the
2708    page that jumps to the main story. Without using this link, a 2708    page that jumps to the main story. Without using this link, a
2709    keyboard user needs to tab through approximately 40 links to reach 2709    keyboard user needs to tab through approximately 40 links to reach
2710    the main story; the screen reader user has to listen to 200 words; 2710    the main story; the screen reader user has to listen to 200 words;
2711    and the screen magnifier user must search around for the location of 2711    and the screen magnifier user must search around for the location of
2712    the main body. 2712    the main body.

2729of techniques that the WCAG Working Group deems sufficient for meeting 2729of techniques that the WCAG Working Group deems sufficient for meeting
2730this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success 2730this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success
2731Criterion if all of the WCAG 2.0 conformance requirements 2731Criterion if all of the WCAG 2.0 conformance requirements
2732<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#conformance-reqs> have 2732<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#conformance-reqs> have

2853Web page 2853Web page
2854  2854 
2855    a non-embedded resource obtained from a single URI using HTTP plus 2855    a non-embedded resource obtained from a single URI using HTTP plus
2856    any other resources that are used in the rendering or intended to be 2856    any other resources that are used in the rendering or intended to be
2857    rendered together with it by a user agent 2857    rendered together with it by a user agent
2858    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#useragentdef> 2858    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#useragentdef>
2859  2859 
2860    /Note 1: /Although any "other resources" would be rendered together 2860    /Note 1: /Although any "other resources" would be rendered together
2861    with the primary resource, they would not necessarily be rendered 2861    with the primary resource, they would not necessarily be rendered
2862    simultaneously with each other. 2862    simultaneously with each other.

2865    resource must be "non-embedded" within the scope of conformance to 2865    resource must be "non-embedded" within the scope of conformance to
2866    be considered a Web page. 2866    be considered a Web page.

2872    http://example.com/mail, but includes an inbox, a contacts area and 2872    http://example.com/mail, but includes an inbox, a contacts area and
2873    a calendar. Links or buttons are provided that cause the inbox, 2873    a calendar. Links or buttons are provided that cause the inbox,
2874    contacts, or calendar to display, but do not change the URI of the 2874    contacts, or calendar to display, but do not change the URI of the

2910    *2.4.2 2910    *2.4.2
2911    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#navigation-mechanisms-title> 2911    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#navigation-mechanisms-title>
2912    Page Titled:* Web pages 2912    Page Titled:* Web pages
2913    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> have 2913    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> have
2914    titles that describe topic or purpose. (Level A) 2914    titles that describe topic or purpose. (Level A)
2915  2915 
2916  2916 
2917      Intent of this Success Criterion 2917      Intent of this Success Criterion
2918  2918 
2919The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users find content and 2919The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users find content and
2920orient themselves within it by ensuring that each Web page has a 2920orient themselves within it by ensuring that each Web page has a
2921descriptive title. Titles identify the current location without 2921descriptive title. Titles identify the current location without
2922requiring users to read or interpret page content. When titles appear in 2922requiring users to read or interpret page content. When titles appear in
2923site maps or lists of search results, users can more quickly identify 2923site maps or lists of search results, users can more quickly identify
2924the content they need. User agents make the title of the page easily 2924the content they need. User agents make the title of the page easily
2925available to the user for identifying the page. For instance, a user 2925available to the user for identifying the page. For instance, a user
2926agent may display the page title in the window title bar or as the name 2926agent may display the page title in the window title bar or as the name
2927of the tab containing the page. 2927of the tab containing the page.
2928  2928 
2929  2929 
2930        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.2 2930        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.2
2931  2931 
2932  * 2932  *
2933  2933 
2934    This criterion benefits all users in allowing users to quickly and 2934    This criterion benefits all users in allowing users to quickly and
2935    easily identify whether the information contained in the Web page is 2935    easily identify whether the information contained in the Web page is
2936    relevant to their needs. 2936    relevant to their needs.
2937  2937 
2938  * 2938  *
2939  2939 
2940    People with visual disabilities will benefit from being able to 2940    People with visual disabilities will benefit from being able to
2941    differentiate content when multiple Web pages are open. 2941    differentiate content when multiple Web pages are open.
2942  2942 
2943  * 2943  *
2944  2944 
2945    People with cognitive disabilities, limited short-term memory and 2945    People with cognitive disabilities, limited short-term memory and
2946    reading disabilities also benefit from the ability to identify 2946    reading disabilities also benefit from the ability to identify
2947    content by its title. 2947    content by its title.
2948  2948 
2949  * 2949  *
2950  2950 
2951    This criterion also benefits people with severe mobility impairments 2951    This criterion also benefits people with severe mobility impairments
2952    whose mode of operation relies on audio when navigating between Web 2952    whose mode of operation relies on audio when navigating between Web
2953    pages. 2953    pages.

2959  2959 
2960    *An HTML Web page* 2960    *An HTML Web page*
2961  2961 
2962    The descriptive title of an HTML Web page is marked up with the 2962    The descriptive title of an HTML Web page is marked up with the
2963    <title> element so that it will be displayed in the title bar of the 2963    <title> element so that it will be displayed in the title bar of the
2964    user agent. 2964    user agent.

2998    *A Web application.* 2998    *A Web application.*
2999  2999 
3000    A banking application lets a user inspect his bank accounts, view 3000    A banking application lets a user inspect his bank accounts, view
3001    past statements, and perform transactions. The Web application 3001    past statements, and perform transactions. The Web application
3002    dynamically generates titles for each Web page, e.g., "Bank XYZ, 3002    dynamically generates titles for each Web page, e.g., "Bank XYZ,
3003    accounts for John Smith" "Bank XYZ, December 2005 statement for 3003    accounts for John Smith" "Bank XYZ, December 2005 statement for
3004    Account 1234-5678". 3004    Account 1234-5678".

3113    rendered together with it by a user agent 3113    rendered together with it by a user agent

3146  3146 
3147    *Focus Order*: 3147    *Focus Order*:
3148    Understanding SC 2.4.3 3148    Understanding SC 2.4.3
3149  3149 
3150    *2.4.3 3150    *2.4.3
3151    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#navigation-mechanisms-focus-order> 3151    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#navigation-mechanisms-focus-order>
3152    Focus Order:* If a Web page 3152    Focus Order:* If a Web page
3153    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> can be 3153    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> can be
3154    navigated sequentially 3154    navigated sequentially
3155    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#nav-seqdef> and the 3155    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#nav-seqdef> and the
3156    navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable 3156    navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable
3157    components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and 3157    components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and
3158    operability. (Level A) 3158    operability. (Level A)
3159  3159 
3160  3160 
3161      Intent of this Success Criterion 3161      Intent of this Success Criterion
3162  3162 
3163The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure that when users 3163The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure that when users
3164navigate sequentially through content, they encounter information in an 3164navigate sequentially through content, they encounter information in an
3165order that is consistent with the meaning of the content and can be 3165order that is consistent with the meaning of the content and can be
3166operated from the keyboard. This reduces confusion by letting users form 3166operated from the keyboard. This reduces confusion by letting users form
3167a consistent mental model of the content. There may be different orders 3167a consistent mental model of the content. There may be different orders
3168that reflect logical relationships in the content. For example, moving 3168that reflect logical relationships in the content. For example, moving
3169through components in a table one row at a time or one column at a time 3169through components in a table one row at a time or one column at a time
3170both reflect the logical relationships in the content. Either order may 3170both reflect the logical relationships in the content. Either order may
3171satisfy this Success Criterion. 3171satisfy this Success Criterion.
3172  3172 
3173The way that sequential navigation order is determined in Web content is 3173The way that sequential navigation order is determined in Web content is
3174defined by the technology of the content. For example, simple HTML 3174defined by the technology of the content. For example, simple HTML
3175defines sequential navigation via the notion of tabbing order. Dynamic 3175defines sequential navigation via the notion of tabbing order. Dynamic
3176HTML may modify the navigation sequence using scripting along with the 3176HTML may modify the navigation sequence using scripting along with the
3177addition of a tabindex attribute to allow focus to additional elements. 3177addition of a tabindex attribute to allow focus to additional elements.
3178If no scripting or tabindex attributes are used, the navigation order is 3178If no scripting or tabindex attributes are used, the navigation order is
3179the order that components appear in the content stream. (See HTML 4.01 3179the order that components appear in the content stream. (See HTML 4.01
3180Specification, section 17.11, "Giving focus to an element"). 3180Specification, section 17.11, "Giving focus to an element").
3181  3181 
3182An example of keyboard navigation that is not the sequential navigation 3182An example of keyboard navigation that is not the sequential navigation
3183addressed by this Success Criterion is using arrow key navigation to 3183addressed by this Success Criterion is using arrow key navigation to
3184traverse a tree component. The user can use the up and down arrow keys 3184traverse a tree component. The user can use the up and down arrow keys
3185to move from tree node to tree node. Pressing the right arrow key may 3185to move from tree node to tree node. Pressing the right arrow key may
3186expand a node, then using the down arrow key, will move into the newly 3186expand a node, then using the down arrow key, will move into the newly
3187expanded nodes. This navigation sequence follows the expected sequence 3187expanded nodes. This navigation sequence follows the expected sequence
3188for a tree control - as additional items get expanded or collapsed, they 3188for a tree control - as additional items get expanded or collapsed, they
3189are added or removed from the navigation sequence. 3189are added or removed from the navigation sequence.
3190  3190 
3191The focus order may not be identical to the programmatically determined 3191The focus order may not be identical to the programmatically determined
3192reading order (see Success Criterion 1.3.2) as long as the user can 3192reading order (see Success Criterion 1.3.2) as long as the user can
3193still understand and operate the Web page. Since there may be several 3193still understand and operate the Web page. Since there may be several
3194possible logical reading orders for the content, the focus order may 3194possible logical reading orders for the content, the focus order may
3195match any of them. However, when the order of a particular presentation 3195match any of them. However, when the order of a particular presentation
3196differs from the programmatically determined reading order, users of one 3196differs from the programmatically determined reading order, users of one
3197of these presentations may find it difficult to understand or operate 3197of these presentations may find it difficult to understand or operate
3198the Web page. Authors should carefully consider all these users as they 3198the Web page. Authors should carefully consider all these users as they
3199design their Web pages. 3199design their Web pages.
3200  3200 
3201For example, a screen reader user interacts with the programmatically 3201For example, a screen reader user interacts with the programmatically
3202determined reading order, while a sighted keyboard user interacts with 3202determined reading order, while a sighted keyboard user interacts with
3203the visual presentation of the Web page. Care should be taken so that 3203the visual presentation of the Web page. Care should be taken so that
3204the focus order makes sense to both of these sets of users and does not 3204the focus order makes sense to both of these sets of users and does not
3205appear to either of them to jump around randomly. 3205appear to either of them to jump around randomly.
3206  3206

3209  3209 
3210These techniques benefit keyboard users who navigate documents 3210These techniques benefit keyboard users who navigate documents
3211sequentially and expect the focus order to be consistent with the 3211sequentially and expect the focus order to be consistent with the
3212sequential reading order. 3212sequential reading order.
3213  3213 
3214  * 3214  *
3215  3215 
3216    People with mobility impairments who must rely on keyboard access 3216    People with mobility impairments who must rely on keyboard access
3217    for operating a page benefit from a logical, usable focus order. 3217    for operating a page benefit from a logical, usable focus order.
3218  3218 
3219  * 3219  *
3220  3220 
3221    People with disabilities that make reading difficult can become 3221    People with disabilities that make reading difficult can become
3222    disoriented when tabbing takes focus someplace unexpected. They 3222    disoriented when tabbing takes focus someplace unexpected. They
3223    benefit from a logical focus order. 3223    benefit from a logical focus order.
3224  3224 
3225  * 3225  *
3226  3226 
3227    People with visual impairments can become disoriented when tabbing 3227    People with visual impairments can become disoriented when tabbing
3228    takes focus someplace unexpected or when they cannot easily find the 3228    takes focus someplace unexpected or when they cannot easily find the
3229    content surrounding an interactive element. 3229    content surrounding an interactive element.
3230  3230 
3231  * 3231  *

3233    Only a small portion of the page may be visible to an individual 3233    Only a small portion of the page may be visible to an individual
3234    using a screen magnifier at a high level of magnification. Such a 3234    using a screen magnifier at a high level of magnification. Such a
3235    user may interpret a field in the wrong context if the focus order 3235    user may interpret a field in the wrong context if the focus order
3236    is not logical. 3236    is not logical.

3239      Examples of Success Criterion 2.4.3 3239      Examples of Success Criterion 2.4.3
3240  3240 
3241 1. 3241 1.
3242  3242 
3243    On a web page that contains a tree of interactive controls, the user 3243    On a web page that contains a tree of interactive controls, the user
3244    can use the up and down arrow keys to move from tree node to tree 3244    can use the up and down arrow keys to move from tree node to tree
3245    node. Pressing the left arrow key expands a node, then using the 3245    node. Pressing the left arrow key expands a node, then using the
3246    down arrow key moves into the newly expanded nodes. 3246    down arrow key moves into the newly expanded nodes.
3247  3247 
3248 2. 3248 2.
3249  3249 
3250    A Web page implements modeless dialogs via scripting. When the 3250    A Web page implements modeless dialogs via scripting. When the
3251    trigger button is activated, a dialog opens. The interactive 3251    trigger button is activated, a dialog opens. The interactive
3252    elements in the dialog are inserted in the focus order immediately 3252    elements in the dialog are inserted in the focus order immediately
3253    after the button. When the dialog is open, the focus order goes from 3253    after the button. When the dialog is open, the focus order goes from
3254    the button to the elements of the dialog, then to the interactive 3254    the button to the elements of the dialog, then to the interactive
3255    element following the button. When the dialog is closed, the focus 3255    element following the button. When the dialog is closed, the focus
3256    order goes from the button to the following element. 3256    order goes from the button to the following element.
3257  3257 
3258 3. 3258 3.
3259  3259 
3260    A Web page implements modal dialogs via scripting. When the trigger 3260    A Web page implements modal dialogs via scripting. When the trigger
3261    button is activated, a dialog opens and focus is set to the first 3261    button is activated, a dialog opens and focus is set to the first
3262    interactive element in the dialog. As long as the dialog is open, 3262    interactive element in the dialog. As long as the dialog is open,
3263    focus is limited to the elements of the dialog. When the dialog is 3263    focus is limited to the elements of the dialog. When the dialog is
3264    dismissed, focus returns to the button or the element following the 3264    dismissed, focus returns to the button or the element following the
3265    button. 3265    button.
3266  3266 
3267 4. 3267 4.
3268  3268 
3269    An HTML Web page is created with the left hand navigation occurring 3269    An HTML Web page is created with the left hand navigation occurring
3270    in the HTML after the main body content, and styled with CSS to 3270    in the HTML after the main body content, and styled with CSS to
3271    appear on the left hand side of the page. This is done to allow 3271    appear on the left hand side of the page. This is done to allow
3272    focus to move to the main body content first without requiring 3272    focus to move to the main body content first without requiring
3273    tabIndex attributes or JavaScript. 3273    tabIndex attributes or JavaScript.
3274  3274 
3275    /Note: /While this example passes the Success Criterion, it is not 3275    /Note: /While this example passes the Success Criterion, it is not
3276    necessarily true that all CSS positioning would. More complex 3276    necessarily true that all CSS positioning would. More complex
3277    positioning examples may or may not preserve meaning and operability 3277    positioning examples may or may not preserve meaning and operability
3278  3278 
3279 5. 3279 5.
3280  3280 
3281    The following example *fails to meet the Success Criterion*: 3281    The following example *fails to meet the Success Criterion*:
3282  3282 
3283    A company's Web site includes a form that collects marketing data 3283    A company's Web site includes a form that collects marketing data
3284    and allows users to subscribe to several newsletters published by 3284    and allows users to subscribe to several newsletters published by
3285    the company. The section of the form for collecting marketing data 3285    the company. The section of the form for collecting marketing data
3286    includes fields such as name, street address, city, state or 3286    includes fields such as name, street address, city, state or
3287    province, and postal code. Another section of the form includes 3287    province, and postal code. Another section of the form includes
3288    several checkboxes so that users can indicate newsletters they want 3288    several checkboxes so that users can indicate newsletters they want
3289    to receive. However, the tab order for the form skips between fields 3289    to receive. However, the tab order for the form skips between fields
3290    in different sections of the form, so that focus moves from the name 3290    in different sections of the form, so that focus moves from the name
3291    field to a checkbox, then to the street address, then to another 3291    field to a checkbox, then to the street address, then to another
3292    checkbox. 3292    checkbox.

3306this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success 3306this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success

3309been met. 3309been met.

3314 1. 3314 1.
3315  3315 
3316    G59: Placing the interactive elements in an order that follows 3316    G59: Placing the interactive elements in an order that follows
3317    sequences and relationships within the content 3317    sequences and relationships within the content
3318    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/NOTE-WCAG20-TECHS-20120103/G59> 3318    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/NOTE-WCAG20-TECHS-20120103/G59>

3473    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#ambiguouslinkdef>. 3473    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#ambiguouslinkdef>.
3474    (Level A) 3474    (Level A)
3475  3475 
3476  3476 
3477      Intent of this Success Criterion 3477      Intent of this Success Criterion
3478  3478 
3479The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users understand the 3479The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users understand the
3480purpose of each link so they can decide whether they want to follow the 3480purpose of each link so they can decide whether they want to follow the
3481link. Whenever possible, provide link text that identifies the purpose 3481link. Whenever possible, provide link text that identifies the purpose
3482of the link without needing additional context. Assistive technology has 3482of the link without needing additional context. Assistive technology has
3483the ability to provide users with a list of links that are on the Web 3483the ability to provide users with a list of links that are on the Web
3484page. Link text that is as meaningful as possible will aid users who 3484page. Link text that is as meaningful as possible will aid users who
3485want to choose from this list of links. Meaningful link text also helps 3485want to choose from this list of links. Meaningful link text also helps
3486those who wish to tab from link to link. Meaningful links help users 3486those who wish to tab from link to link. Meaningful links help users
3487choose which links to follow without requiring complicated strategies to 3487choose which links to follow without requiring complicated strategies to
3488understand the page. 3488understand the page.
3489  3489 
3490In some situations, authors may want to provide part of the description 3490In some situations, authors may want to provide part of the description
3491of the link in logically related text that provides the context for the 3491of the link in logically related text that provides the context for the
3492link. In this case the user should be able to identify the purpose of 3492link. In this case the user should be able to identify the purpose of
3493the link without moving focus from the link. In other words, they can 3493the link without moving focus from the link. In other words, they can
3494arrive on a link and find out more about it without losing their place. 3494arrive on a link and find out more about it without losing their place.
3495This can be achieved by putting the description of the link in the same 3495This can be achieved by putting the description of the link in the same
3496sentence, paragraph, list item, the heading immediately preceding the 3496sentence, paragraph, list item, the heading immediately preceding the
3497link, or table cell as the link, or in the table header cell for a link 3497link, or table cell as the link, or in the table header cell for a link
3498in a data table, because these are directly associated with the link 3498in a data table, because these are directly associated with the link
3499itself. 3499itself.
3500  3500 
3501This context will be most usable if it precedes the link. (For instance, 3501This context will be most usable if it precedes the link. (For instance,
3502if you must use ambiguous link text, it is better to put it at the end 3502if you must use ambiguous link text, it is better to put it at the end
3503of the sentence that describes its destination, rather than putting the 3503of the sentence that describes its destination, rather than putting the
3504ambiguous phrase at the beginning of the sentence.) If the description 3504ambiguous phrase at the beginning of the sentence.) If the description
3505follows the link, there can be confusion and difficulty for screen 3505follows the link, there can be confusion and difficulty for screen
3506reader users who are reading through the page in order (top to bottom). 3506reader users who are reading through the page in order (top to bottom).
3507  3507 
3508Links with the same destination should have the same descriptions (per 3508Links with the same destination should have the same descriptions (per
3509Success Criterion 3.2.4 3509Success Criterion 3.2.4
3510<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#consistent-behavior-consistent-functionality>), 3510<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#consistent-behavior-consistent-functionality>),
3511but links with different purposes and destinations should have different 3511but links with different purposes and destinations should have different
3512descriptions. 3512descriptions.
3513  3513 
3514The Success Criterion includes an exception for links for which the 3514The Success Criterion includes an exception for links for which the
3515purpose of the link cannot be determined from the information on the Web 3515purpose of the link cannot be determined from the information on the Web
3516page. In this situation, the person with the disability is not at a 3516page. In this situation, the person with the disability is not at a
3517disadvantage; there is no additional context available to understand the 3517disadvantage; there is no additional context available to understand the
3518link purpose. However, whatever amount of context is available on the 3518link purpose. However, whatever amount of context is available on the
3519Web page that can be used to interpret the purpose of the link must be 3519Web page that can be used to interpret the purpose of the link must be
3520made available in the link text or programmatically associated with the 3520made available in the link text or programmatically associated with the
3521link to satisfy the Success Criterion. 3521link to satisfy the Success Criterion.
3522  3522 
3523/Note: /There may be situations where the purpose of the link is is 3523/Note: /There may be situations where the purpose of the link is is
3524supposed to be unknown or obscured. For instance, a game may have links 3524supposed to be unknown or obscured. For instance, a game may have links
3525identified only as door #1, door #2, and door #3. This link text would 3525identified only as door #1, door #2, and door #3. This link text would
3526be sufficient because the purpose of the links is to create suspense for 3526be sufficient because the purpose of the links is to create suspense for
3527all users. 3527all users.

3534  3534 
3535  * 3535  *
3536  3536 
3537    This Success Criterion helps people with motion impairment by 3537    This Success Criterion helps people with motion impairment by
3538    letting them skip links that they are not interested in, avoiding 3538    letting them skip links that they are not interested in, avoiding
3539    the keystrokes needed to visit the referenced content and then 3539    the keystrokes needed to visit the referenced content and then
3540    returning to the current content. 3540    returning to the current content.
3541  3541 
3542  * 3542  *
3543  3543 
3544    People with cognitive limitations will not become disoriented by 3544    People with cognitive limitations will not become disoriented by
3545    multiple means of navigation to and from content they are not 3545    multiple means of navigation to and from content they are not
3546    interested in. 3546    interested in.
3547  3547

3550    People with visual disabilities will be able to determine the 3550    People with visual disabilities will be able to determine the
3551    purpose of a link by exploring the link's context. 3551    purpose of a link by exploring the link's context.

3562    Medieval period of history." Where "Medieval period of history" is a 3562    Medieval period of history." Where "Medieval period of history" is a
3563    link. 3563    link.

3571    Ireland's Commission on Electronic Voting at Go Vote!" where "Go 3571    Ireland's Commission on Electronic Voting at Go Vote!" where "Go
3572    Vote!" is a link. 3572    Vote!" is a link.

3574  * 3574  *
3575  3575 
3576    *Both an icon and text are included in the same link* 3576    *Both an icon and text are included in the same link*
3577  3577 
3578    An icon of a voting machine and the text "Government of Ireland's 3578    An icon of a voting machine and the text "Government of Ireland's
3579    Commission of Electronic Voting" are combined to make a single link. 3579    Commission of Electronic Voting" are combined to make a single link.
3580    The alt text for the icon is null, since the purpose of the link is 3580    The alt text for the icon is null, since the purpose of the link is
3581    already described by the text of the link next to the icon. 3581    already described by the text of the link next to the icon.
3582  3582 
3583  * 3583  *
3584  3584 
3585    *A list of book titles* 3585    *A list of book titles*
3586  3586 
3587    A list of books is available in three formats: HTML, PDF, and mp3 (a 3587    A list of books is available in three formats: HTML, PDF, and mp3 (a
3588    recording of a person reading the book). To avoid hearing the title 3588    recording of a person reading the book). To avoid hearing the title
3589    of each book three times (once for each format), the first link for 3589    of each book three times (once for each format), the first link for
3590    each book is the title of the book, the second link says "PDF" and 3590    each book is the title of the book, the second link says "PDF" and
3591    the third says, "mp3." 3591    the third says, "mp3."

3596  3596 
3597    A Web page contains a collection of news articles. The main page 3597    A Web page contains a collection of news articles. The main page
3598    lists the first few sentences of each article, followed by a "Read 3598    lists the first few sentences of each article, followed by a "Read
3599    more" link. A screen reader command to read the current paragraph 3599    more" link. A screen reader command to read the current paragraph
3600    provides the context to interpret the purpose of the link. 3600    provides the context to interpret the purpose of the link.

3624      Techniques and Failures for Success Criterion 2.4.4 - Link Purpose 3624      Techniques and Failures for Success Criterion 2.4.4 - Link Purpose
3625      (In Context) 3625      (In Context)
3626  3626 
3627Each numbered item in this section represents a technique or combination 3627Each numbered item in this section represents a technique or combination
3628of techniques that the WCAG Working Group deems sufficient for meeting 3628of techniques that the WCAG Working Group deems sufficient for meeting
3629this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success 3629this Success Criterion. The techniques listed only satisfy the Success
3630Criterion if all of the WCAG 2.0 conformance requirements 3630Criterion if all of the WCAG 2.0 conformance requirements
3631<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#conformance-reqs> have 3631<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#conformance-reqs> have
3632been met. 3632been met.

3809      Key Terms 3809      Key Terms
3810  3810 
3811ambiguous to users in general 3811ambiguous to users in general
3812  3812 
3813    the purpose cannot be determined from the link and all information 3813    the purpose cannot be determined from the link and all information
3814    of the Web page presented to the user simultaneously with the link 3814    of the Web page presented to the user simultaneously with the link
3815    (i.e., readers without disabilities would not know what a link would 3815    (i.e., readers without disabilities would not know what a link would
3816    do until they activated it) 3816    do until they activated it)
3817  3817 
3818    /Example: /The word guava in the following sentence "One of the 3818    /Example: /The word guava in the following sentence "One of the
3819    notable exports is guava" is a link. The link could lead to a 3819    notable exports is guava" is a link. The link could lead to a
3820    definition of guava, a chart listing the quantity of guava exported 3820    definition of guava, a chart listing the quantity of guava exported
3821    or a photograph of people harvesting guava. Until the link is 3821    or a photograph of people harvesting guava. Until the link is
3822    activated, all readers are unsure and the person with a disability 3822    activated, all readers are unsure and the person with a disability
3823    is not at any disadvantage. 3823    is not at any disadvantage.

3839    determinable from a link in English includes text that is in the 3839    determinable from a link in English includes text that is in the
3840    same paragraph, list, or table cell as the link or in a table header 3840    same paragraph, list, or table cell as the link or in a table header
3841    cell that is associated with the table cell that contains the link. 3841    cell that is associated with the table cell that contains the link.

3851    Understanding SC 2.4.5 3851    Understanding SC 2.4.5
3852  3852 
3853    *2.4.5 3853    *2.4.5
3854    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#navigation-mechanisms-mult-loc> 3854    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#navigation-mechanisms-mult-loc>
3855    Multiple Ways:* More than one way is available to locate a Web page 3855    Multiple Ways:* More than one way is available to locate a Web page
3856    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> within a 3856    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#webpagedef> within a
3857    set of Web pages 3857    set of Web pages
3858    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#set-of-web-pagesdef> 3858    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#set-of-web-pagesdef>
3859    except where the Web Page is the result of, or a step in, a process 3859    except where the Web Page is the result of, or a step in, a process
3860    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#processdef>. (Level AA) 3860    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#processdef>. (Level AA)
3861  3861 
3862  3862 
3863      Intent of this Success Criterion 3863      Intent of this Success Criterion
3864  3864 
3865The intent of this Success Criterion is to make it possible for users to 3865The intent of this Success Criterion is to make it possible for users to
3866locate content in a manner that best meets their needs. Users may find 3866locate content in a manner that best meets their needs. Users may find
3867one technique easier or more comprehensible to use than another. 3867one technique easier or more comprehensible to use than another.
3868  3868 
3869Even small sites should provide users some means of orientation. For a 3869Even small sites should provide users some means of orientation. For a
3870three or four page site, with all pages linked from the home page, it 3870three or four page site, with all pages linked from the home page, it
3871may be sufficient simply to provide links from and to the home page 3871may be sufficient simply to provide links from and to the home page
3872where the links on the home page can also serve as a site map. 3872where the links on the home page can also serve as a site map.
3873  3873 
3874  3874 
3875        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.5 3875        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.5
3876  3876 
3877  * 3877  *
3878  3878 
3879    Providing an opportunity to navigate sites in more than one manner 3879    Providing an opportunity to navigate sites in more than one manner
3880    can help people find information faster. Users with visual 3880    can help people find information faster. Users with visual
3881    impairments may find it easier to navigate to the correct part of 3881    impairments may find it easier to navigate to the correct part of
3882    the site by using a search, rather than scrolling through a large 3882    the site by using a search, rather than scrolling through a large
3883    navigation bar using a screen magnifier or screen reader. A person 3883    navigation bar using a screen magnifier or screen reader. A person
3884    with cognitive disabilities may prefer a table of contents or site 3884    with cognitive disabilities may prefer a table of contents or site
3885    map that provides an overview of the site rather than reading and 3885    map that provides an overview of the site rather than reading and
3886    traversing through several Web pages. Some users may prefer to 3886    traversing through several Web pages. Some users may prefer to
3887    explore the site in a sequential manner, moving from Web page to Web 3887    explore the site in a sequential manner, moving from Web page to Web
3888    page in order to best understand the concepts and layout. 3888    page in order to best understand the concepts and layout.
3889  3889 
3890  * 3890  *
3891  3891 
3892    Individuals with cognitive limitations may find it easier to use 3892    Individuals with cognitive limitations may find it easier to use
3893    search features than to use a hierarchical navigation scheme that be 3893    search features than to use a hierarchical navigation scheme that be
3894    difficult to understand. 3894    difficult to understand.
3895  3895 
3896  3896 
3897      Examples of Success Criterion 2.4.5 3897      Examples of Success Criterion 2.4.5
3898  3898 
3899  * 3899  *
3900  3900 
3901    *A search mechanism.* 3901    *A search mechanism.*
3902  3902 
3903    A large food processing company provides a site containing recipes 3903    A large food processing company provides a site containing recipes
3904    created using its products. The site provides a search mechanism to 3904    created using its products. The site provides a search mechanism to
3905    search for recipes using a particular ingredient. In addition, it 3905    search for recipes using a particular ingredient. In addition, it
3906    provides a list box that lists several categories of foods. A user 3906    provides a list box that lists several categories of foods. A user
3907    may type "soup" in to the search engine or may select "soup" from 3907    may type "soup" in to the search engine or may select "soup" from
3908    the list box to go to a page with a list of recipes made from the 3908    the list box to go to a page with a list of recipes made from the
3909    company's soup products 3909    company's soup products
3910  3910 
3911  * 3911  *
3912  3912 
3913    *Links between Web pages.* 3913    *Links between Web pages.*
3914  3914 
3915    A local hair salon has created a Web site to promote its services. 3915    A local hair salon has created a Web site to promote its services.
3916    The site contains only five Web pages. There are links on each Web 3916    The site contains only five Web pages. There are links on each Web
3917    page to sequentially move forward or backward through the Web pages. 3917    page to sequentially move forward or backward through the Web pages.
3918    In addition, each Web page contains a list of links to reach each of 3918    In addition, each Web page contains a list of links to reach each of
3919    the other Web pages. 3919    the other Web pages.
3920  3920 
3921  * 3921  *
3922  3922 
3923    *Where content is a result of a process or task - Funds transfer 3923    *Where content is a result of a process or task - Funds transfer
3924    confirmation.* 3924    confirmation.*
3925  3925 
3926    An on-line banking site allows fund transfer between accounts via 3926    An on-line banking site allows fund transfer between accounts via
3927    the Web. There is no other way to locate the confirmation of fund 3927    the Web. There is no other way to locate the confirmation of fund
3928    transfer until the account owner completes the transfer. 3928    transfer until the account owner completes the transfer.
3929  3929 
3930  * 3930  *
3931  3931 
3932    *Where content is a result of a process or task - Search engine 3932    *Where content is a result of a process or task - Search engine
3933    results.* 3933    results.*
3934  3934 
3935    A search engine provides the search results based on user input. 3935    A search engine provides the search results based on user input.
3936    There is no other way to locate the search results except to perform 3936    There is no other way to locate the search results except to perform
3937    the search process itself. 3937    the search process itself.

4029    a non-embedded resource obtained from a single URI using HTTP plus 4029    a non-embedded resource obtained from a single URI using HTTP plus
4030    any other resources that are used in the rendering or intended to be 4030    any other resources that are used in the rendering or intended to be
4031    rendered together with it by a user agent 4031    rendered together with it by a user agent
4032    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#useragentdef> 4032    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#useragentdef>

4035    with the primary resource, they would not necessarily be rendered 4035    with the primary resource, they would not necessarily be rendered
4036    simultaneously with each other. 4036    simultaneously with each other.

4040    be considered a Web page. 4040    be considered a Web page.

4046    http://example.com/mail, but includes an inbox, a contacts area and 4046    http://example.com/mail, but includes an inbox, a contacts area and

4048    contacts, or calendar to display, but do not change the URI of the 4048    contacts, or calendar to display, but do not change the URI of the

4093    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#navigation-mechanisms-descriptive> 4093    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#navigation-mechanisms-descriptive>
4094    Headings and Labels:* Headings and labels 4094    Headings and Labels:* Headings and labels
4095    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#labeldef> describe 4095    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#labeldef> describe
4096    topic or purpose. (Level AA) 4096    topic or purpose. (Level AA)
4097  4097 
4098  4098 
4099      Intent of this Success Criterion 4099      Intent of this Success Criterion
4100  4100 
4101The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users understand what 4101The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users understand what
4102information is contained in Web pages and how that information is 4102information is contained in Web pages and how that information is
4103organized. When headings are clear and descriptive, users can find the 4103organized. When headings are clear and descriptive, users can find the
4104information they seek more easily, and they can understand the 4104information they seek more easily, and they can understand the
4105relationships between different parts of the content more easily. 4105relationships between different parts of the content more easily.
4106Descriptive labels help users identify specific components within the 4106Descriptive labels help users identify specific components within the
4107content. 4107content.
4108  4108 
4109Labels and headings do not need to be lengthy. A word, or even a single 4109Labels and headings do not need to be lengthy. A word, or even a single
4110character, may suffice if it provides an appropriate cue to finding and 4110character, may suffice if it provides an appropriate cue to finding and
4111navigating content. 4111navigating content.
4112  4112 
4113  4113 
4114        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.6 4114        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.6
4115  4115 
4116  * 4116  *
4117  4117 
4118    Descriptive headings are especially helpful for users who have 4118    Descriptive headings are especially helpful for users who have
4119    disabilities that make reading slow and for people with limited 4119    disabilities that make reading slow and for people with limited
4120    short-term memory. These people benefit when section titles make it 4120    short-term memory. These people benefit when section titles make it
4121    possible to predict what each section contains. 4121    possible to predict what each section contains.
4122  4122 
4123  * 4123  *
4124  4124 
4125    People who have difficulty using their hands or who experience pain 4125    People who have difficulty using their hands or who experience pain
4126    when doing so will benefit from techniques that reduce the number of 4126    when doing so will benefit from techniques that reduce the number of
4127    keystrokes required to reach the content they need. 4127    keystrokes required to reach the content they need.
4128  4128 
4129  * 4129  *
4130  4130 
4131    This Success Criterion helps people who use screen readers by 4131    This Success Criterion helps people who use screen readers by
4132    ensuring that labels and headings are meaningful when read out of 4132    ensuring that labels and headings are meaningful when read out of
4133    context, for example, in a Table of Contents, or when jumping from 4133    context, for example, in a Table of Contents, or when jumping from
4134    heading to heading within a page. 4134    heading to heading within a page.
4135  4135 
4136    This Success Criterion may also help users with low vision who can 4136    This Success Criterion may also help users with low vision who can
4137    see only a few words at a time. 4137    see only a few words at a time.
4138  4138

4140      Examples of Success Criterion 2.4.6 4140      Examples of Success Criterion 2.4.6
4141  4141 
4142  * 4142  *
4143  4143 
4144    *A news site.* 4144    *A news site.*
4145  4145 
4146    The home page of a news site lists the headlines for the top stories 4146    The home page of a news site lists the headlines for the top stories
4147    of the hour. Under each heading are the first 35 words of the story 4147    of the hour. Under each heading are the first 35 words of the story
4148    and a link to the full article. Each headline gives a clear idea of 4148    and a link to the full article. Each headline gives a clear idea of
4149    the article's subject. 4149    the article's subject.
4150  4150 
4151  * 4151  *
4152  4152 
4153    *A guide on how to write well* 4153    *A guide on how to write well*
4154  4154 
4155    A guide on writing contains the following section titles: How To 4155    A guide on writing contains the following section titles: How To
4156    Write Well, Cut Out Useless Words, Identify Unnecessary Words, etc. 4156    Write Well, Cut Out Useless Words, Identify Unnecessary Words, etc.
4157    The section headings are clear and concise and the structure of the 4157    The section headings are clear and concise and the structure of the
4158    information is reflected in the structure of the headings. 4158    information is reflected in the structure of the headings.
4159  4159 
4160  * 4160  *
4161  4161 
4162    *Consistent headings in different articles* 4162    *Consistent headings in different articles*
4163  4163 
4164    A Web site contains papers from a conference. Submissions to the 4164    A Web site contains papers from a conference. Submissions to the
4165    conference are required to have the following organization: Summary, 4165    conference are required to have the following organization: Summary,
4166    Introduction, [other sections unique to this article], Conclusion, 4166    Introduction, [other sections unique to this article], Conclusion,
4167    Author Biography, Glossary, and Bibliography. The title of each Web 4167    Author Biography, Glossary, and Bibliography. The title of each Web
4168    page clearly identifies the article it contains, creating a useful 4168    page clearly identifies the article it contains, creating a useful
4169    balance between the uniqueness of the articles and the consistency 4169    balance between the uniqueness of the articles and the consistency
4170    of the section headings. 4170    of the section headings.
4171  4171

4175  4175 
4176    A form asks the name of the user. It consists of two input fields to 4176    A form asks the name of the user. It consists of two input fields to
4177    ask for the first and last name. The first field is labeled "First 4177    ask for the first and last name. The first field is labeled "First
4178    name", the second is labeled "Last name"." 4178    name", the second is labeled "Last name"."

4251  4251 
4252label 4252label
4253  4253 
4254    text <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#textdef> or 4254    text <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#textdef> or
4255    other component with a text alternative 4255    other component with a text alternative
4256    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#text-altdef> that is 4256    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#text-altdef> that is
4257    presented to a user to identify a component within Web content 4257    presented to a user to identify a component within Web content
4258    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#contentdef> 4258    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#contentdef>
4259  4259 
4260    /Note 1: / A label is presented to all users whereas the name 4260    /Note 1: / A label is presented to all users whereas the name
4261    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#namedef> may be 4261    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#namedef> may be
4262    hidden and only exposed by assistive technology. In many (but not 4262    hidden and only exposed by assistive technology. In many (but not
4263    all) cases the name and the label are the same. 4263    all) cases the name and the label are the same.
4264  4264 
4265    /Note 2: /The term label is not limited to the label element in HTML. 4265    /Note 2: /The term label is not limited to the label element in HTML.

4275    Focus Visible:* Any keyboard operable user interface has a mode of 4275    Focus Visible:* Any keyboard operable user interface has a mode of
4276    operation where the keyboard focus indicator is visible. (Level AA) 4276    operation where the keyboard focus indicator is visible. (Level AA)

4282one mode of operation where the keyboard focus indicator can be visually 4282one mode of operation where the keyboard focus indicator can be visually
4283located. 4283located.

4288  * 4288  *
4289  4289 
4290    This Success Criterion helps anyone who relies on the keyboard to 4290    This Success Criterion helps anyone who relies on the keyboard to
4291    operate the page, by letting them visually determine the component 4291    operate the page, by letting them visually determine the component
4292    on which keyboard operations will interact at any point in time. 4292    on which keyboard operations will interact at any point in time.

4297    limitations in executive processes benefit by being able to discover 4297    limitations in executive processes benefit by being able to discover
4298    where the focus is located. 4298    where the focus is located.

4305    When text fields receive focus, a vertical bar is displayed in the 4305    When text fields receive focus, a vertical bar is displayed in the
4306    field, indicating that the user can insert text, OR all of the text 4306    field, indicating that the user can insert text, OR all of the text
4307    is highlighted, indicating that the user can type over the text. 4307    is highlighted, indicating that the user can type over the text.

4440orient herself within a set of Web pages, a Web site, or a Web 4440orient herself within a set of Web pages, a Web site, or a Web
4441application and find related information. 4441application and find related information.
