4444        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.8 4444        Specific Benefits of Success Criterion 2.4.8
4445  4445 
4446  * 4446  *
4447  4447 
4448    This Success Criterion is helpful for people with a short attention 4448    This Success Criterion is helpful for people with a short attention
4449    span who may become confused when following a long series of 4449    span who may become confused when following a long series of
4450    navigation steps to a Web page. It is also helpful when a user 4450    navigation steps to a Web page. It is also helpful when a user
4451    follows a link directly to a page deep within a set of Web pages and 4451    follows a link directly to a page deep within a set of Web pages and
4452    needs to navigate that Web site to understand the content of that 4452    needs to navigate that Web site to understand the content of that
4453    page or to find more related information. 4453    page or to find more related information.

4459  4459 
4460    *Links to help user determine their location in a site* 4460    *Links to help user determine their location in a site*
4461  4461 
4462    A research group is part of an educational department at a 4462    A research group is part of an educational department at a
4463    university. The group's home page links to the department home page 4463    university. The group's home page links to the department home page
4464    and the university's home page. 4464    and the university's home page.
4465  4465 
4466  * 4466  *
4467  4467 
4468    *A breadcrumb trail* 4468    *A breadcrumb trail*
4469  4469 
4470    A portal Web site organizes topics into categories. As the user 4470    A portal Web site organizes topics into categories. As the user
4471    navigates through categories and subcategories, a breadcrumb trail 4471    navigates through categories and subcategories, a breadcrumb trail
4472    shows the current location in the hierarchy of categories. Each page 4472    shows the current location in the hierarchy of categories. Each page
4473    also contains a link to the portal home page. 4473    also contains a link to the portal home page.

4604  4604 
4605  4605 
4606      Intent of this Success Criterion 4606      Intent of this Success Criterion
4607  4607 
4608The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users understand the 4608The intent of this Success Criterion is to help users understand the
4609purpose of each link in the content, so they can decide whether they 4609purpose of each link in the content, so they can decide whether they
4610want to follow it. Best practice is that links with the same destination 4610want to follow it. Best practice is that links with the same destination
4611would have the same descriptions, but links with different purposes and 4611would have the same descriptions, but links with different purposes and
4612destinations would have different descriptions (see also Success 4612destinations would have different descriptions (see also Success
4613Criterion 3.2.4 4613Criterion 3.2.4
4614<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#consistent-behavior-consistent-functionality> 4614<http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#consistent-behavior-consistent-functionality>
4615which calls for consistency in identifying components that have the same 4615which calls for consistency in identifying components that have the same
4616functionality). Because the purpose of a link can be identified from its 4616functionality). Because the purpose of a link can be identified from its
4617link text, links can be understood when they are out of context, such as 4617link text, links can be understood when they are out of context, such as
4618when the user agent provides a list of all the links on a page. 4618when the user agent provides a list of all the links on a page.
4619  4619 
4620The Success Criterion includes an exception for links for which the 4620The Success Criterion includes an exception for links for which the
4621purpose of the link cannot be determined from the information on the Web 4621purpose of the link cannot be determined from the information on the Web
4622page. In this situation, the person with the disability is not at a 4622page. In this situation, the person with the disability is not at a
4623disadvantage; there is no additional context available to understand the 4623disadvantage; there is no additional context available to understand the
4624link purpose. However, whatever amount of context is available on the 4624link purpose. However, whatever amount of context is available on the
4625Web page that can be used to interpret the purpose of the link must be 4625Web page that can be used to interpret the purpose of the link must be
4626made available in the link text to satisfy the Success Criterion. 4626made available in the link text to satisfy the Success Criterion.
4627  4627 
4628The word "mechanism" is used to allow authors to either make all links 4628The word "mechanism" is used to allow authors to either make all links
4629fully understandable out of context by default or to provide a way to 4629fully understandable out of context by default or to provide a way to
4630make them this way. This is done because for some pages, making the 4630make them this way. This is done because for some pages, making the
4631links all unambiguous by themselves makes the pages easier for some 4631links all unambiguous by themselves makes the pages easier for some
4632users and harder for others. Providing the ability to make the links 4632users and harder for others. Providing the ability to make the links
4633unambiguous (by them selves) or not provides both users with 4633unambiguous (by them selves) or not provides both users with
4634disabilities with the ability to use the page in the format that best 4634disabilities with the ability to use the page in the format that best
4635meets their needs. 4635meets their needs.
4636  4636 
4637For example: A page listing 100 book titles along with links to download 4637For example: A page listing 100 book titles along with links to download
4638the books in HTML, PDF, DOC, TXT, MP3, or AAC might ordinarily be viewed 4638the books in HTML, PDF, DOC, TXT, MP3, or AAC might ordinarily be viewed
4639as the title of the book as a link with the words "in HTML" after it. 4639as the title of the book as a link with the words "in HTML" after it.
4640then the sentence "Also available in: " followed by a series of short 4640then the sentence "Also available in: " followed by a series of short
4641links with text of "HTML", "PDF", "DOC", "TXT", "MP3", and "AAC". At 4641links with text of "HTML", "PDF", "DOC", "TXT", "MP3", and "AAC". At
4642Level 3, some users could opt to view the page this way - because they 4642Level 3, some users could opt to view the page this way - because they
4643would find the page harder to understand or slower to use if the full 4643would find the page harder to understand or slower to use if the full
4644title of the book were included in each of the links. Others could opt 4644title of the book were included in each of the links. Others could opt
4645to view the page with the full title as part of each of the links so 4645to view the page with the full title as part of each of the links so
4646that each link was understandable in itself. Both the former and the 4646that each link was understandable in itself. Both the former and the
4647latter groups could include people with visual or cognitive disabilities 4647latter groups could include people with visual or cognitive disabilities
4648that used different techniques to browse or that had different types or 4648that used different techniques to browse or that had different types or
4649severities of disability. 4649severities of disability.

4653  4653 
4654  * 4654  *
4655  4655 
4656    This Success Criterion helps people with motion impairment by 4656    This Success Criterion helps people with motion impairment by
4657    letting them skip Web pages that they are not interested in, 4657    letting them skip Web pages that they are not interested in,
4658    avoiding the keystrokes needed to visit the referenced content and 4658    avoiding the keystrokes needed to visit the referenced content and
4659    then return to the current content. 4659    then return to the current content.
4660  4660

4664    extra navigation to and from content they are not interested in. 4664    extra navigation to and from content they are not interested in.
4665  4665

4669    place in the content when they return to the original page. The 4669    place in the content when they return to the original page. The
4670    screen reader's list of links is more useful for finding information 4670    screen reader's list of links is more useful for finding information
4671    because the target of the links are described. 4671    because the target of the links are described.

4681    Commission of Electronic Voting" are combined to make a single link. 4681    Commission of Electronic Voting" are combined to make a single link.

4688    recording of a person reading the book). The title of the book is 4688    recording of a person reading the book). The title of the book is
4689    followed by links to the different formats. The rendered text for 4689    followed by links to the different formats. The rendered text for
4690    each link is just the format type, but the text associated with each 4690    each link is just the format type, but the text associated with each
4691    link includes the title as well as the format; for instance, 4691    link includes the title as well as the format; for instance,
4692    "Gulliver's Travels, MP3." 4692    "Gulliver's Travels, MP3."

4862    definition of guava, a chart listing the quantity of guava exported 4862    definition of guava, a chart listing the quantity of guava exported

4865    is not at any disadvantage. 4865    is not at any disadvantage.

4896    and other ways to add a heading to different types of content. 4896    and other ways to add a heading to different types of content.

4898    /Note 2: /This success criterion covers sections within writing, not 4898    /Note 2: /This success criterion covers sections within writing, not
4899    user interface components 4899    user interface components
4900    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#user-interface-componentdef>. 4900    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#user-interface-componentdef>.
4901    User Interface components are covered under Success Criterion 4.1.2 4901    User Interface components are covered under Success Criterion 4.1.2
4902    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#ensure-compat-rsv>. 4902    <http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-WCAG20-20081211/#ensure-compat-rsv>.
4903  4903 
4904  4904 
4905      Intent of this Success Criterion 4905      Intent of this Success Criterion
4906  4906 
4907The intent of this Success Criterion is to provide headings for sections 4907The intent of this Success Criterion is to provide headings for sections
4908of a Web page, when the page is organized into sections. For instance, 4908of a Web page, when the page is organized into sections. For instance,
4909long documents are often divided into a variety of chapters, chapters 4909long documents are often divided into a variety of chapters, chapters
4910have subtopics and subtopics are divided into various sections, sections 4910have subtopics and subtopics are divided into various sections, sections
4911into paragraphs, etc. When such sections exist, they need to have 4911into paragraphs, etc. When such sections exist, they need to have
4912headings that introduce them. This clearly indicates the organization of 4912headings that introduce them. This clearly indicates the organization of
4913the content, facilitates navigation within the content, and provides 4913the content, facilitates navigation within the content, and provides
4914mental "handles" that aid in comprehension of the content. Other page 4914mental "handles" that aid in comprehension of the content. Other page
4915elements may complement headings to improve presentation (e.g., 4915elements may complement headings to improve presentation (e.g.,
4916horizontal rules and boxes), but visual presentation is not sufficient 4916horizontal rules and boxes), but visual presentation is not sufficient
4917to identify document sections. 4917to identify document sections.
4918  4918 
4919This provision is included at Level AAA because it cannot be applied to 4919This provision is included at Level AAA because it cannot be applied to
4920all types of content and it may not always be possible to insert 4920all types of content and it may not always be possible to insert
4921headings. For example, when posting a pre-existing document to the Web, 4921headings. For example, when posting a pre-existing document to the Web,
4922headings that an author did not include in the original document cannot 4922headings that an author did not include in the original document cannot
4923be inserted. Or, a long letter would often cover different topics, but 4923be inserted. Or, a long letter would often cover different topics, but
4924putting headings into a letter would be very strange. However, if a 4924putting headings into a letter would be very strange. However, if a
4925document can be broken up into sections with headings, it facilitates 4925document can be broken up into sections with headings, it facilitates
4926both understanding and navigation. 4926both understanding and navigation.

5031    graphics, tables, lists and sub-sections. 5031    graphics, tables, lists and sub-sections.
5032  5032 
5033user interface component 5033user interface component
5034  5034 
5035    a part of the content that is perceived by users as a single control 5035    a part of the content that is perceived by users as a single control
5036    for a distinct function 5036    for a distinct function
5037  5037 
5038    /Note 1: /Multiple user interface components may be implemented as a 5038    /Note 1: /Multiple user interface components may be implemented as a
5039    single programmatic element. Components here is not tied to 5039    single programmatic element. Components here is not tied to
5040    programming techniques, but rather to what the user perceives as 5040    programming techniques, but rather to what the user perceives as
5041    separate controls. 5041    separate controls.
5042  5042 
5043    /Note 2: /User interface components include form elements and links 5043    /Note 2: /User interface components include form elements and links
5044    as well as components generated by scripts. 5044    as well as components generated by scripts.
5045  5045 
5046    /Example: /An applet has a "control" that can be used to move 5046    /Example: /An applet has a "control" that can be used to move
5047    through content by line or page or random access. Since each of 5047    through content by line or page or random access. Since each of
5048    these would need to have a name and be settable independently, they 5048    these would need to have a name and be settable independently, they
5049    would each be a "user interface component." 5049    would each be a "user interface component."
